headline: Fight to Repair, Not to Win
body: Conflict doesn’t mean failure—it’s how you grow closer when it’s handled with care.
prompt: What’s one argument you could revisit calmly to help your partner feel more understood?

headline: Simple Meals = Safe Meals
body: You don’t need creativity—you need calm. Simplicity is how you remind your nervous system that it’s safe to receive.
prompt: What’s one simple meal you could repeat this week that brings relief—not pressure?

headline: Regulate the Room, Regulate the Meal
body: You don’t need to fix your food—you might just need to soften your space. The nervous system eats too.
prompt: What could you shift in your environment this week to make food feel more grounding and safe?

headline: Food Can Be the First Step Back
body: When you can’t think your way to regulation, you can feed your way there. One soft meal. One grounding bite.
prompt: What reset food could you return to this week—not for discipline, but for emotional reentry?

headline: Small Acts, Big Connection
body: Relationships grow through consistency, calmness, and small daily efforts—not grand romantic gestures.
prompt: What small gesture could you make today to show care without needing words?

headline: Speak to Understand, Not Just to Be Heard
body: Connection deepens when we listen with presence, not just with ears. Slow down. See each other.
prompt: When was the last time you listened without planning a reply? Could today be another chance?
